item.title: Former MTSU football player charged with animal cruelty
item.description: A former MTSU football player has been charged with animal cruelty following the investigation into a video posted to Snapchat, according to Rutherford County PAWS.
item.dc:creator: Heather Hourigan

item.title: Construction worker shot in leg in Edgehill
item.description: A construction worker was shot in the leg during a robbery in Edgehill.
item.dc:creator: Stuart Ervin

item.title: Former Waynesboro police officer faces theft, misconduct charges
item.description: A former police officer with the Waynesboro Police Department has been charged with theft and official misconduct.
item.dc:creator: Stuart Ervin

item.title: Bus drivers accused of traffic violations still driving for Metro Schools
item.description: There has been a lot of scrutiny on school bus drivers since a deadly school bus crash in Chattanooga last November.
item.dc:creator: Lindsay Bramson

item.title: Officer hit by vehicle in Cadiz, KY
item.description: A police officer was hit by a vehicle in front of Trigg County High School in Cadiz, KY, on Monday afternoon.
item.dc:creator: Stuart Ervin

item.title: Tennessee Senate to vote on optional 'In God We Trust' tags
item.description: The full state Senate is poised to vote on a bill that would allow Tennessee drivers to choose license plates with the phrase "In God We Trust" on them.

item.title: 'Moral Movement' pushes for special legislative session for Medicaid expansion
item.description: They are ministers, mothers, healthcare advocates, a cancer patient and a student. Together, they're members of a new collective called "The Moral Movement."
item.dc:creator: Hayley Mason

item.title: Dump truck driver killed in Wilson County crash
item.description: The driver of a dump truck was killed in a rollover crash in Wilson County on Monday afternoon.
item.dc:creator: Stuart Ervin

item.title: Metro police search for man accused of assaulting girlfriend
item.description: Metro detectives are searching for a man accused of physically assaulting his girlfriend and pointing a pistol at her.
item.dc:creator: Stuart Ervin

item.title: Metro Council to interview candidates to replace former Judge Moreland
item.description: A committee of the Metro Council will hold public interviews of the candidates who want to replace former General Sessions Judge Casey Moreland.

item.title: Mayor, director of schools discuss Metro Schools' budget
item.description: Metro Nashville Public Schools is asking for more money this year than ever before.

item.title: THP releases names of 3 first responders injured in crash
item.description: The wreck happened around 8:15 p.m. at the intersection of New Shackle Island Road and Drakes Creek Road in Hendersonville.

item.title: Meeting planned to address sudden closure of landfill
item.description: State environmental officials have called an emergency meeting Monday night in Camden, TN.

item.title: Democrat Mackler announces bid for Tennessee US Senate seat
item.description: Nashville attorney and former Army helicopter pilot James Mackler says he is running for the Democratic nomination to represent Tennessee in the U.S. Senate.

item.title: Dog named 'Lucky' helps save man from burning home
item.description: A Springfield woman’s dog is being called a hero after alerting her to a nearby house fire.

item.title: Funeral held for man killed in shooting at Cookeville plant
item.description: Family and friends of Tyler Stults gathered Monday to say their final goodbyes.
item.dc:creator: Stuart Ervin

item.title: Man pleads guilty to accessing competitor's network
item.description: A man has pleaded guilty to using a former employer's computer network to access information to benefit his own company.

item.title: Nashville Predators playing Chicago Blackhawks at home for Game 3
item.description: Game 1 and Game 2 were both played in Chicago, but the Predators will return home to Music City for Game 3.
item.dc:creator: Kara Apel

item.title: Former counselor accused of submitting false claims to TennCare
item.description: A former Davidson County counselor has been charged for allegedly submitting false claims to TennCare.

item.title: Vanderbilt honors memory of former teammate Donny Everett
item.description: The Commodores picked this past weekend to honor the memory of their former pitcher, teammate and brother, Donny Everett.

item.title: First responders hit while working crash in Sumner County Saturday night
item.description: Investigators are looking for answers into a crash that injured a number of first responders working a crash in Hendersonville Saturday night.

item.title: Search for gunman continues after shooting outside Antioch bar
item.description: An argument inside an Antioch bar led shots being fired early Sunday morning.

item.description: Two men are behind bars in connection to a string of hotel robberies across Middle Tennessee.

item.title: Dolly Parton calls college course about her a 'blessing'
item.description: Dolly Parton has called it a "blessing" that the University of Tennessee at Knoxville is offering a class about her.

item.title: NASA invest $9.9M in University of Tennessee-led team
item.description: A research team led by the University of Tennessee Knoxville has received a $9.9 million grant from NASA toward the development of a more aerodynamically capable aircraft.

item.title: Tennessee joins states urging court to reinstate travel ban
item.description: Tennessee is joining more than a dozen other states in urging an appeals court to reinstate President Donald Trump's revised travel ban.

item.title: Residents safely escape apartment building fire in Bellevue
item.description: It's a rough morning for two families who are now homeless after an apartment fire in Bellevue.

item.description: Officers responded to a robbery at a Lebanon Kroger around 8 p.m. Friday night.

item.title: Knob Hill proposed development on hold for now
item.description: A victory for residents against a proposed development in a west Nashville neighborhood. Highland View at The Knob looks to develop 36 acres off Knob Road. Thursday evening, the concept plan was defeated 4-2 by the Nashville planning commission.
item.dc:creator: Edward Burch

item.title: Purity Dairy's 17th year Moosic City Dairy Run attracts 3,000
item.description: Over 3,000 people participated in Purity Dairy’s 17th year Moosic City Dairy Run Saturday morning.

item.description: Metro Police are searching for two men they believe are behind a robbery and carjacking.

item.title: Fentress Co. sheriff resigns amid federal investigation
item.description: The FBI and TBI raided the sheriff’s office in Jamestown, TN, earlier this week. No arrests were made, but several boxes of files were confiscated.

item.description: One person was killed in a crash involving a motorcycle in Cheatham County on Friday night.

item.title: Family disputes accusation after woman charged in death of infant son
item.description: A Hopkinsville mother is accused of manslaughter second degree in the death of her own infant son. Her family argues she's not responsible.

item.title: Woman hit by MTA bus talks about recovery
item.description: A Tennessee Department of Mental Health and Substance Abuse employee was on her way to work. She had just gotten off an MTA bus in downtown Nashville when she was hit and dragged several feet.
item.dc:creator: Carley Gordon

item.title: Woman who says she was sexually abused by cab driver speaks out
item.description: A Nashville woman said although she works downtown, she can’t bring herself to ride in another cab after she was sexually abused by a driver.

item.title: Police: Man brought grandchildren to heroin deal
item.description: A man and woman have been arrested after Metro police say they brought the man’s grandchildren to a heroin deal.

item.title: Police: FL man facing child porn charges dead from apparent suicide in Nashville
item.description: Police say a fugitive wanted on federal child pornography charges in Florida has died from an apparent suicide in a Nashville hotel room.

item.title: Nashville man changing minds on Jefferson Street
item.description: Thirty years ago, a Nashville man had a bold idea for a new business on Jefferson Street. It was different, and friends and neighbors told him it would never work. But it did.

item.description: Firefighters spent more than seven hours putting out the blaze at an abandoned warehouse on 3rd Avenue North near First Tennessee Park.

item.title: Gas tax, health care complicate Tennessee governor's race
item.description: Unexpected twists in a state gas tax bill, a presidential nomination and the failure of congressional effort to repeal former President Barack Obama's health care law are complicating the Republican campaign to succeed...

item.description: A worker with Superior Traffic Control was killed in a crash on Interstate 24 in Rutherford County Thursday night.

item.title: Police: Nashville man dies from injuries after fight with teenagers
item.description: Police are investigating the death of a Nashville market clerk who was hit in the head during a fight with two teenagers.

item.title: Judge declares mistrial in infant starvation case
item.description: A judge has declared a mistrial and dismissed the indictment of parents facing charges in the starvation death of their baby.

item.title: Tennessee officers leave hospital after assault by inmates
item.description: Tennessee officials say three correctional officers have returned home from the hospital after they were assaulted in a disturbance involving 16 inmates.

item.title: Smyrna police issue alert about endangered runaway
item.description: Katelyn Conway, 17, ran away from a temporary custody placement on Feb. 13.

item.title: This week marks 6-year anniversary of Holly Bobo's disappearance
item.description: Six years after her strange disappearance, Holly Bobo's family is thanking the community for their continued support.

item.title: Couple kicked off United flight on the way to their wedding
item.description: A couple flying to Costa Rica for their wedding later this week were removed from a United Airlines flight in Houston for not following crew instructions.

item.title: Manhunt expanded for suspect in Facebook video killing
item.description: Authorities in several states were on the lookout Monday for a man police say shot a Cleveland retiree collecting aluminum cans and then posted video of the apparently random killing on Facebook.

item.title: Carlie Trent's kidnapper gets 25-year sentence
item.description: Gary Simpson, 58, entered an Alford plea to one count of especially aggravated kidnapping and one count of aggravated sexual battery, court officials confirmed to WCYB.

item.title: 2 WB lanes back open on I-20 after road buckles in DeKalb County
item.description: Two westbound lanes are back open on I-20 after all lanes were previously closed between Candler Road and Gresham Road in DeKalb County when the interstate buckled.
